first_para: Anne Frances Milton (née Turner; born 3 November 1955) is a British Conservative Party politician who has been the Member of Parliament (MP) for Guildford since 2005. After service on the Health Select Committee, in November 2006 she was appointed Shadow Minister for Tourism. In July 2007 she was appointed Shadow Health Minister. In 2010, she was appointed parliamentary under-secretary of state for health as part of the Conservative-Liberal Democrat coalition government. Following a ministerial reshuffle in September 2012, Milton is currently a Government whip.

full.extract:
Anne Frances Milton (née Turner; born 3 November 1955) is a British Conservative Party politician who has been the Member of Parliament (MP) for Guildford since 2005. After service on the Health Select Committee, in November 2006 she was appointed Shadow Minister for Tourism. In July 2007 she was appointed Shadow Health Minister. In 2010, she was appointed parliamentary under-secretary of state for health as part of the Conservative-Liberal Democrat coalition government. Following a ministerial reshuffle in September 2012, Milton is currently a Government whip.
^ Jenkin axed in Cameron reshuffle. BBC News (8 November 2006). Retrieved on 13 March 2012.
^ Guildford | Conservatives. Annemilton.com. Retrieved on 13 March 2012.
^ Her Majesty’s Government. Number 10 (19 May 2010). Retrieved on 13 March 2012.
full.title: Anne Milton
